info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:22PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Rutherford, southeastern Polk, southwestern Cleveland, north central Laurens, northwestern Chester, southeastern Greenville, southwestern York, Spartanburg, Cherokee and northern Union Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Columbus to 7 miles northeast of Gaffney. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Gaffney, Union, Fountain Inn, Boiling Springs SC, Woodruff, Duncan, Lyman, Pacolet and Landrum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
